Dating: 22ND DYNASTY (not before); 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not after)
Name: Canopic jar with lid
Description: Canopic jar with lid in the shape of a human head. The stocky body of the vessel has very curved walls with the centre of gravity roughly in the middle. The wide rim and the base are virtually the same size. The rim is bevelled slightly on the inside. The base is only roughly smoothened. Inside, only the upper third of the jar has been hollowed out in a rough cylindrical shape. On the front is an inscription in black ink.
